intro: Angadenia cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban angadenia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Cuba. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
